items.name: Aluminium Beam
items.description: Resistant to weather, but lighter than Stone Buildings, Aluminium Buildings are an asset when traveling to new areas far from your dropship or base, bringing with you the equivalent of a Stone Base in your backpack. Can be repaired with a Repair Hammer .

items.name: Dirt Corner
items.description: Dirt Corners are a Tier 1  buildable that are used in tandem with Dirt Ramps , allowing for the creation of rounded ramps. Due to the nature of its building material, Dirt Corners must be attached to the terrain when placed; failure to do so will result in the collapse of the building piece.

items.name: Dirt Foundation
items.description: Dirt Foundations are a Tier 1  buildable that serves as an alternative to Thatch Beams / Wood Beams that provides a more natural look to structures. Due to the nature of its building material, Dirt Foundations must be attached to the terrain when placed; failure to do so will result in the collapse of the building piece.

items.name: Dirt Ramp
items.description: Dirt Ramps are a Tier 1  buildable that serves as an alternative to Thatch Ramps / Wood Ramps that provides a more natural look to structures. Due to the nature of its building material, Dirt Ramps must be attached to the terrain when placed; failure to do so will result in the collapse of the building piece.

items.name: Glass Beam
items.description: Glass building pieces while not being very resistance to damage, nor providing any thermal insulation, bring a nice aesthetic to any base. Green houses for outpost bases or for internal base pieces while on prospects are good uses for these items.

items.name: Glass Door
items.description: Glass building pieces while not being very resistance to damage, nor providing any thermal insulation, bring a nice aesthetic to any base. Green houses for outpost bases or for internal base pieces while on prospects are good uses for these items.

items.name: Glass Roof
items.description: Glass building pieces while not being very resistance to damage, nor providing any thermal insulation, bring a nice aesthetic to any base. Green houses for outpost bases or for internal base pieces while on prospects are good uses for these items. Can be crafted as Reinforced Glass, increasing resistance to weather up to the level of Stone building peices and increasing HP from 500 to 2500.

items.name: Thatch Beam
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For different orientations, hold R while holding a Thatch Beam (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

items.name: Thatch Door
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Can be attached to door frames (hold R while holding a Wall Building Piece and select the door frame variant from the radial menu).

items.name: Thatch Floor
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For the trapdoor floor variant, hold R while holding a Thatch Floor and select the Trapdoor variant from the radial wheel (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

items.name: Thatch Floor
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For the trapdoor floor variant, hold R while holding a Thatch Floor and select the Trapdoor variant from the radial wheel (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

items.name: Thatch Halfpieces
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For different variants, hold R while holding a Thatch Halfpiece (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

items.name: Thatch Halfpitches
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For different variants, hold R while holding Thatch Halfpitches (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

items.name: Thatch Ladder
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and best used as temporary shelters while away from any 'Main Base' the prospectors may have established. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Thatch ladders cannot be snapped to trapdoor floors.

items.name: Thatch Railing
items.description: The Thatch Railing is part of the Thatch Building Trim Set , which is learned in the Tier 1  Tech Tree after unlocking the Thatch Building Base Set .

items.name: Thatch Roof
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For the Ramp/Stairs variant, hold R while holding a Thatch Roof (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

items.name: Thatch Roof Corner
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For different variants, hold R while holding a Thatch Roof Corner (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

items.name: Thatch Trapdoor
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best suited as emergency shelters. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Attaches to floors with trapdoor holes (hold R while holding a floor building piece and select the Trapdoor variant from the radial wheel).

items.name: Thatch Wall
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For window/doorway variants, hold R while holding a Thatch Wall (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

items.name: Thatch Wall Angled
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For different variants, hold R while holding a Thatch Wall Angled (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

items.name: Thatch Window
items.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Attaches to window frames (hold R while holding a wall building piece and select the Window Frame variant from the radial wheel).

items.name: Wall Torch
items.description: Wall lighting for a prospector's base. Provides limited heat. Will not be damaged by storms if placed outside.

items.name: Wood Beam
items.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood beams require another structure for adjacent 'snapping' and seem to apply 'well stabilized' to a larger area than the Thatch Beam .

items.name: Wood Trapdoor
items.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for Prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable, they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Attaches to floors with trapdoor holes (hold R while holding a floor piece and select the Trapdoor variant from the radial wheel).

items.name: Wood Wall
items.description: Wood Wall is crafted in the Character Crafting with the following resources:

items.name: Wood Wall Angled
items.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood wall angles may be snapped into existing floors or walls such as Wood Wall . Holding 'R' while placing the angled wood wall for additional placement styles or directionality.

items.name: Wood Wall Fortification
items.description: The Wood Wall Fortification serves as large wall that can attach Wood Spikes Fortifications to fend off the predators of Icarus. Similar to Medium Wood Hedgehogs , the Wood Wall Fortification does not take damage during storms.

items.name: Wood Window
items.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for Prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable, they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood Windows may be snapped into walls such as Wood Wall that have been placed in 'window' configuration. Holding 'R' while placing a Wood Wall , for example, allows for additional placement styles, such as the window frame.
